questionOne.question: Do you have any employees in Massachusetts?

options.label: No
options.message: You are not required to remit payment to the department starting 7/1.

questionTwo.question: How many of your MA employees receive W2s?

questionThree.question: How many 1099 contractors have you hired in the past year?

overMinEmpOver1099.paragraph: You are required to remit payment to the department starting 7/1 and you are liable for a portion of your employees medical leave contribution because you have more than 25 total employees in Massachusetts.
You are required to remit payment on behalf of your contractors. Employers with 50% or more of their workforce made up of 1099s need to consider these as full time employees under the new language.

overMinEmpUnder1099.paragraph: You are required to remit payment to the department starting 7/1 and you are liable for a portion of your employees medical leave contribution because you have more than 25 total employees in Massachusetts.
You are not required to remit payment on behalf of your contractors because you have less than 50% of contractors.

underMinEmpOver1099.paragraph: You are not liable for medical leave payment for your employees because you have less than 25 total employees in Massachusetts.
You are not required to remit payment on behalf of your contractors because you have less than 50% of contractors.

underMinEmpUnder1099.paragraph: You are not required to remit payment to the department starting 7/1 because you have less than 25 total employees in Massachusetts.
